info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 16 at 4:21PM EDT until May 16 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern York County in Upstate South Carolina... Central Cherokee County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 500 PM EDT. * At 421 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles east of Gaffney, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Gaffney, Blacksburg, Sharon, Hickory Grove, Smyrna, Cherokee Falls, Draytonville, Kings Creek, Bethany and Kings Mountain State Park. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
